result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marzell A Moore

records.addlTxt:
For non-compliance with Outpatient Competency Restoration Program. Upon detention defendant is to remain in custody until inpatient treatment bed space is available at Mendota or Winnebago Mental Health.  Once bed space is available Waukesha County Sheriff's Department is to transport the defendant immediately.

EXT CODE #3

Filed by Dr. Lundbohm advising that the defendant is no longer clinically appropriate for the program.

 **Reviewed by Judge Reilly, for Branch 7, 11/1/22 - Pursuant to Wis. Stat. 971.14(5) I authorize the execution of a warrant for arrest and order transport to an inpatient facility - if no bed is available defendant to remain in the Waukesha County Jail until a bed is available.**
Review hearing on January 19, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

1:41 PM; Case called for Review hearing. Defendant Marzell A Moore in court.  Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen Jr. in court for Marzell A Moore.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes a report was filed on 10/7/2022 noting the defendant was accepted into OCRP.  Atty. Jensen advises he believes the OCRP is appropriate for his client and has outlined the requirements for the program with his client.  Atty. Jensen requests the matter be set for a continued review hearing in about 90 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for continued review hearing in about 90 days.
Review hearing scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
From OCRP

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Order for Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed by Judge Paul F Reilly September 2, 2022.
Review hearing on October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:38 PM; Case called for Review hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Marzell A Moore in court.  Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen Jr. in court for Marzell A Moore.  Court notes the matter is before the Court to review the competency report from Dr. Goebel.  Court inquires if counsel have received and reviewed the report.  State has reviewed the report and is not contesting the findings.  Atty. Jensen advises he has received and reviewed the report with his client and they are not contesting the findings.  Based on there being no contest and based on Dr. Geobel's findings the Court will find the defendant is not competent but likely to become competent with treatment under 971.14(5) and will order the defendant into treatment.  Court will also make a referral to the Outpatient Competency Restoration Program.  Court will adjourn for a review with respect to the OCRP in about 45 days.
Review hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Prepared and filed by Dr. Goebel with Cover Sheet for Confidential Records.
Review hearing on September 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:16 AM; Case called for Review hearing.  Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen in court.   Defendant Marzell A Moore did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Reider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes at the last hearing a competency evaluation was ordered, but the doctor conducting the evaluation has not been able to contact the defendant to schedule the evaluation.  Based on the non-appearance and the defendant's failure to comply with the court ordered evaluation the Court will issue a capias and order bail be forfeited.  With respect to the TR matter the court will not enter default judgment at this time, it will hold the matter open pending the defendant being before this court on the warrant issued in this matter.

Defendant Marzell A Moore in court at 10:18 a.m.; all other appearances remain the same. Court will not issue the capias and will reinstate the bail.  Court confirmed with the defendant his current address and telephone number.  Court inquires why the defendant has not complied with the court ordered evaluation.  Defendant responds.  Court inquires how we can be sure the defendant will now comply with the order for evaluation; does defendant need to be taken into custody for this to be accomplished.  Atty. Jensen asks that the court not take his client into custody, he will try to assist the defendant in making sure he complies with the court order for the competency evaluation.  Court takes a break at 10:21 a.m. to allow Atty. Jensen to contact WFU to set up an evaluation date for his client.  Case recalled at 10:29 a.m.; all appearances remain the same.  Atty. Jensen advises that he spoke with WFU and have set up an evaluation on August 17 at 11:00 a.m.  Court confirms that information with the defendant.  Court will adjourn for a new review hearing with respect to the competency evaluation.  Review hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

Filed by Dr. Jenna Goebel advising she attempted to call the defendant numerous times to schedule the evaluation but was not able to get a hold of him.  As a result Dr. Goebel will not be able to complete the evaluation and file a report as ordered by the Court.
Review hearing on August 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Signed by Commissioner Rieck on 06/29/2022.

09:52 AM Defendant Marzell A Moore in court with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.  The Court will set this matter before the Trial Court for a review on competency.  Review hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
